document_title: Chronic heart failure: Causes, symptoms and diagnosis
subsection_content:
Several measures can be taken to help reduce the risk of developing chronic heart failure, including:
Maintain a reasonable weight; Limit alcohol intake; Stop smoking; Exercise regularly (such as walking, swimming...); Maintain a healthy diet; It is also important to address underlying risk factors, such as hypertension and anemia. Doctors can advise on the best way to manage these conditions.
